SEARCH
Package main.errormatcher

Interface ErrorMatcher

All Known Implementing Classes:
CodeErrorMatcher
public interface ErrorMatcher
Interface for error checking in Java code. Each method checks for a specific type of error pattern in a given code string.

    Checks for the absence of spaces in expressions, which may affect readability.

  • Method Details

    • checkOverflow

      boolean checkOverflow(String code)
      Checks for Overflow errors in the provided code.
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check for overflow errors.
      Returns:
      true if an overflow error is detected, false otherwise.

      Returns:
      true if a roundoff error is detected, false otherwise.

    • checkSquelchExceptions

      boolean checkSquelchExceptions(String code)
      Checks for cases where exceptions are squelched (caught but not handled or rethrown).
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check for squelched exceptions.
      Returns:
      true if squelched exceptions are detected, false otherwise.

    • checkCatchFinallyInSameTry

      boolean checkCatchFinallyInSameTry(String code)
      Checks for cases where catch and finally are used in the same try statement.
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check for catch and finally used together in the same try block.
      Returns:
      true if both catch and finally are used together, false otherwise.

    • checkMagicNumbers

      boolean checkMagicNumbers(String code)
      Checks for magic numbers in the provided code (e.g., using hardcoded numbers instead of named constants).
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check for magic numbers.
      Returns:
      true if magic numbers are detected, false otherwise.

    • checkAlwaysUseBraces

      boolean checkAlwaysUseBraces(String code)
      Checks for the use of braces in control structures (e.g., if, for, while) for clarity and proper structure.
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check for missing braces in control structures.
      Returns:
      true if the code violates the "Always Use Braces" rule, false otherwise.

    • checkExactComparisonOfFloats

      boolean checkExactComparisonOfFloats(String code)
      Checks for exact comparison of floating-point numbers (using ==) in the provided code.
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check for exact comparison of floating-point numbers.
      Returns:
      true if exact floating-point comparisons are found, false otherwise.

    • checkCompareStringsWithEqualityOperator

      boolean checkCompareStringsWithEqualityOperator(String code)
      Checks for the use of the equality operator (==) to compare strings in the provided code.
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check for using == to compare strings.
      Returns:
      true if == is used for string comparison, false otherwise.

    • checkDanglingElseProblem

      boolean checkDanglingElseProblem(String code)
      Checks for the Dangling Else Problem in the provided code.
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check for the dangling else problem.
      Returns:
      true if the dangling else problem is detected, false otherwise.

    • checkAbsenceOfTryCatch

      boolean checkAbsenceOfTryCatch(String code)
      Checks for the absence of a try-catch construct in the provided code.
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check.
      Returns:
      true if no try-catch construct is found, false otherwise.

    • checkAbsenceOfSpacesInExpressions

      boolean checkAbsenceOfSpacesInExpressions(String code)
      Checks for the absence of spaces in expressions, which may affect readability.
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check.
      Returns:
      true if expressions lack spaces, false otherwise.

    • checkMisplacedSemicolonAfterControlStructure

      boolean checkMisplacedSemicolonAfterControlStructure(String code)
      Checks for misplaced semicolons after if statements or loop constructs, which can cause unintended empty statements.
      Parameters:
      code - The Java code to check.
      Returns:
      true if a misplaced semicolon is detected, false otherwise.

    • checkFileNameClassNameMismatch

      boolean checkFileNameClassNameMismatch(String filename, String code)
      Checks if the name of the file and the class do not match, which is required for public classes in Java.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file containing the Java code.
      code - The Java code to check.
      Returns:
      true if the file name and class name do not match, false otherwise.
